# segment_command

macOS 10.6+

```
struct segment_command {
    ...
};
```

## [Topics](/documentation/kernel/segment_command#topics)

### [Instance Properties](/documentation/kernel/segment_command#1611853)

[`cmd`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command/1525326-cmd)Common to all load command structures. Set to `LC_SEGMENT` for this structure.[`cmdsize`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command/1525493-cmdsize)[`fileoff`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command/1525429-fileoff)Indicates the offset in this file of the data to be mapped at `vmaddr`.[`filesize`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command/1525609-filesize)[`flags`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command/1525271-flags)[`initprot`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command/1525260-initprot)[`maxprot`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command/1525877-maxprot)[`nsects`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command/1525814-nsects)[`segname`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command/1525506-segname)[`vmaddr`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command/1525654-vmaddr)[`vmsize`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command/1525419-vmsize)Indicates the number of bytes of virtual memory occupied by this segment. See also the description of `filesize`, below.
